answers.feedback_html: A yard is a bigger unit than a foot. One yard is equal to three feet.
1 yard is made up of 3 feet and 3.281 feet makes 1 meter. Convert yards to feet and then make the conversion of length to meters.
Remember that a yard is a larger unit than feet and meters are larger than yards.
Use the relation between yards and feet to convert the length into feet and then use feet-meter relation to obtain the length in meters.

stem_html: The length of an American football field is 100\,\text{yd}, excluding the end zones. How long is the field in meters? Round to the nearest 0.1\,\text{m}.

answers.content_html: the limitations of the measuring device
answers.feedback_html: The limited accuracy of the device could be a source of uncertainty.

answers.content_html: the skill of the person making the measurement
answers.feedback_html: The skill of the person, or lack of adequate skill, could affect the uncertainty in measurement.

answers.content_html: the regularities in the object being measured
answers.feedback_html: Regularities in what is being measured would reduce, not increase, uncertainty.

answers.content_html: other factors that affect the outcome (depending on the situation)
answers.feedback_html: Other factors not listed could contribute to the uncertainly.

stem_html: Which of the following does not contribute to the uncertainty?

answers.content_html: Line A is a decreasing line while line B is an increasing line, with line B being much steeper than line A.
answers.feedback_html: The line A decreases at a much faster rate than line B increases.

answers.content_html: Line B is a decreasing line while line A is an increasing line, with line A being much steeper than line B.

answers.content_html: Line B is a decreasing line while line A is an increasing line, with line B being much steeper than line A.
answers.feedback_html: What does the sign of the slope mean? The magnitude of the slope determines the steepness of line.

Recheck the calculation for percent uncertainty in distance. Also, the percent uncertainly in time will be the ratios of 1 second by total time in seconds.
Percent uncertainty is the ratio of uncertainty in measurement upon total measure.

stem_html:

  2. Calculate the uncertainty in the elapsed time.
  3. What is the average speed in meters per second?
  4. What is the uncertainty in the average speed?

The slope can be found by the ratio of change in the y value by corresponding change in the x value.
Subtract the two y values, subtract the two x values and take the ratio \frac{\Delta y}{\Delta x}.

answers.feedback_html: You may have wrongly assumed 1\,\text{km} is 100\,\text{m}. The prefix kilo indicates 1000. Use 1000\,\text{m} = 1\,\text{m} and convert.

To convert speed from \text{m/s} to \text{km/h}, just multiply the speed given in \text{m/s} by 3.6.

answers.feedback_html: There is an uncertainty of 5 beats per minute in the pulse rate. Find the percent uncertainty by multiplying the ratio of uncertainty in the measurement by 100.
5 out of 130 is the uncertainty fraction, convert this into a percentage.
An uncertainty of 5 out of 130 is equivalent to around 4\% of 130.
Multiply the fraction \frac{5}{130} with 100 and then round off to the nearest integer.
